title: Hong Kong Skyscraper Is Engulfed in Flames
description: The fire at the 42-story tower, which is under construction, sent sparks and debris shooting across the night sky. News reports said two people were injured.

title: In First Wartime Meeting, Blinken Confronts His Russian Counterpart
description: Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken said he told Sergey V. Lavrov, the Russian foreign minister, that Moscow must end its war against Ukraine and return to a nuclear arms control treaty.

title: Nicaragua’s Human Rights Abuses Similar to Nazi Regime, Investigators Find
description: A U.N. inquiry found that President Daniel Ortega and top members of his government committed human rights abuses, providing evidence for efforts to try them overseas.

title: Your Friday Briefing: G20 Sparring Over Ukraine
description: Also, a suspected poisoning of schoolgirls in Iran and a crackdown on migrants in Tunisia.

title: Tunisia’s President Vilifies Migrants From Sub-Saharan Africa
description: As African migrants are swept up in a widening crackdown, critics say President Kais Saied is openly mining a deep vein of discrimination and prejudice against dark-skinned people in Tunisia.

title: Russian Group With Ukraine Ties Say They Took Control of a Russian Village
description: President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia canceled a trip to be briefed on the incursion near the border with Ukraine. He described the incident as a “terrorist” attack.

title: Hubble Telescope Faces Threat From SpaceX and Other Companies’ Satellites
description: Scientists found that an increasing number of pictures made by the iconic orbital observatory are being disrupted by passing satellites.

title: As France Faces Backlash in Africa, Macron Tries Reset With Ex-Colonies
description: President Emmanuel Macron has embarked on a four-country visit as he slashes the French military presence and says colonial-era habits and attitudes must die.

title: MI5 Missed Chance to Stop Manchester Bombing, Inquiry Finds
description: The domestic security service MI5 failed to act on intelligence about the suicide attacker before he killed 22 people at a pop concert, an investigation concluded.

title: Live Updates: Blinken and Lavrov Meet For the First Time Since Russia’s Invasion of Ukraine
description: Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken and Foreign Minister Sergey V. Lavrov of Russia briefly spoke one on one during a Group of 20 summit, U.S. officials said.

title: Harry and Meghan Told to Leave Frogmore Cottage, Their U.K. Home Base
description: Queen Elizabeth II offered Frogmore Cottage to the couple at the time of their wedding, and it was the couple’s home base on infrequent visits to Britain.

title: How A.I. Can Help
description: ChatGPT is changing how people work. That can be scary. But for now, most jobs are still safe.

title: A Ukrainian Mayor Disappeared, but Questions of His Loyalty Did Not
description: Traitor or hero? A decision by the former mayor of Kherson to remain in his post under Russian occupation has divided opinion, even after he vanished.

title: Canadians Fume as Migrants Surge at Their Border
description: A surge in illegal crossings from the United States has led to calls to shut down a rural road on the Canadian border.

title: When Clothes Fly Off, This Intimacy Coordinator Steps In
description: Jessica Steinrock’s work on intimate scenes in film has come to prominence as the entertainment industry reels from the litany of sexual abuses brought to light by the #MeToo movement.

title: Anger Mounts in Greece After Deadly Train Crash
description: As the death toll rose to 47, protesters clashed with the police outside the headquarters of the rail operator, and train employees went on strike.

title: In the Ukraine war, talking about peace is a fight of its own.
description: Russia and the West have argued for months about which side is more willing to negotiate, with the world as an audience.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Here’s what you need to know.

title: Leave Russia? A Year Later Many Companies Can’t, or Won’t.
description: Not all Western companies packed up and left Russia after its invasion of Ukraine. Some say Moscow has tied their hands, while others choose to stay put.

title: Ukraine Reinforces Embattled Bakhmut, but Mission Is Unclear
description: Amid persistent rumors of Ukrainian withdrawal from the war’s most prolonged battle, officials said nothing about the size or purpose of the reinforcement.

title: Hundreds of Schoolgirls Fall Sick in Iran, and Officials Suspect Poisoning
description: Girls have been hospitalized in over 10 cities with respiratory, cardiac and neurological symptoms. Senior officials said they might have been poisoned.

title: Biden Challenged by Softening Public Support for Arming Ukraine
description: Proponents of more aid fear that growing taxpayer fatigue toward shipping tens of billions of dollars overseas could undercut the war effort.

title: U.S. Braces for G20 Clash Over Ukraine War
description: China is urging the start of peace talks, and some Group of 20 nations could support that idea when they gather in India, but U.S. officials argue Russia would not negotiate in good faith.
